comments:
I am unable to create a JAR file after creating a plug-in using the PDE.  
Currently I am using version 20020412.  I have also confirmed that this 
behavior exists in M5.

I have tried several things to resolve this but with no success.  I was 
directed here by one of the news group corresponents.

I have tried:
1) Importing the plug-ins into my workspace.
2) -Dws=win32
3) Adding the eclipse plug-in directory to the ant preferences.
4) select all plug-ins in the PDE preferences.

To Reproduce:
Remove eclipse.  Unzip M5 or 20020412 to same directory.
Start eclipse.  Select File->New->Project.  Select Plug-in Development.  Select 
Plug-in Project.  Click next.  For project name local.mine.test.  Click next.  
Click next on the structure page.  On the generators page select code 
generation wizard radio button.  Select Default Plug-in Structure and click 
next.  Click finish on the content page.  In the packages view expand the 
plugin node.  Right click on the plugin.xml node.  Select Create Plug-in JARs.  
Select test.jar and click finish.  You will get the following errors.

// -----------------------------------------------------------------------
// Begin plugin.xml
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
<plugin
   name="Test Plugin"
   id="local.mine.test"
   version="1.0.0"
   class="local.mine.test.TestPlugin">

   <requires>
      <import plugin="org.eclipse.core.runtime"/>
      <import plugin="org.eclipse.core.resources"/>
      <import plugin="org.eclipse.ui"/>
   </requires>

   <runtime>
      <library name="test.jar"/>
   </runtime>


</plugin>
// End plugin.xml
// -----------------------------------------------------------------------

// -----------------------------------------------------------------------
// Begin build.properties
source.test.jar = src/
// End build.properties
// -----------------------------------------------------------------------

The pluginLocation test will be removed. Locations will be file system 
locations relative to the target plug-in.
